description: The object `tabris.device` provides information about the device that executes the application. All properties are read-only.

platform.description: The name of the platform. Currently either `"Android"` or `"iOS"`. This property is also available globally as `device.platform`.

version.description: The platform version. On iOS it lools like this: `"8.1.1"`. On Android, the [version code](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/Build.VERSION_CODES.html) is returned. This property is also available globally as `device.version`.

model.description: The name of the device model. For example `"iPad4,1"` or `"Nexus 7"`. This property is also available globally as `device.model`.

language.description: The user language configured on the device as an [RFC 4646](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4646) compliant string. For example `"de"`, `"es-ES"`, etc. This property is also available globally as `navigator.language`.

screenWidth.description: The entire width of the device's screen in device independent pixel. Depends on the current device orientation. This property is also available as globally as [screen.width](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen.width).

screenHeight.description: The entire height of the device's screen in device independent pixel. Depends on the current device orientation. This property is also available globally as [screen.height](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen.height).

scaleFactor.description: The ratio between physical pixels and device independent pixels. This property is also available globally as [`window.devicePixelRatio`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window.devicePixelRatio).

orientation.description: The device orientation. One of `portrait-primary`, `portrait-secondary`, `landscape-primary`, and `landscape-secondary`.

change:orientation.description: Fired when the `orientation` property has changed and the rotation animation has finished.
